meanings.sent1: The insentiences of the rock made it unaware of its surroundings.
meanings.sent2: The insentiences of the plant allowed it to grow without knowing it was being observed.
meanings.sent3: The insentiences of the teddy bear made it the perfect companion for the child's tea party.
meanings.sent4: The insentiences of the night sky whispered secrets to those who gazed upon its vastness.
meanings.sent5: The insentiences of the deep ocean depths held mysteries beyond human comprehension.

meanings.definition: The state of being without sensation or feeling
meanings.sent1: The insentiences of the numb hand puzzled the doctor.
meanings.sent2: The insentiences of the stone made it impossible to tell if it was hot or cold.
meanings.sent3: The insentiences of the robot's touch amused the curious child.
meanings.sent4: The insentiences of the desert sand felt like a blanket of warmth under the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The insentiences of the snowflake landing on her nose brought a moment of pure joy.
